FuncDef: The display vrrp load-balance command displays the information about a load-balance redundancy group (LBRG) and its member groups. The display vrrp load-balance command displays the information about a load-balance redundancy group (LBRG) and its member groups.
CLIs: display vrrp load-balance [ interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } vrid <virtual-router-id> ] [ member-vrrp [ vrid <member-vrrp-virtual-router-id> ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type and number of an interface.
-

Specifies the ID of an LBRG member group.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Specifies the ID of an LBRG.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Displays the information about LBRG member groups.
-

ExtraInfo: After you add a VRRP backup group to an LBRG, run the display vrrp load-balance command to check whether the VRRP backup group is successfully added to the LBRG. If an LBRG member group is abnormal, run the display vrrp load-balance command to view the information about the LBRG and its member groups. The information includes the interface on which the LBRG and its member groups are located and the statuses of the LBRG and its member groups. You can use the information to locate faults.
